title: ICT admin cracks down on dengue violators: arrests 4, seals 3 outlets
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 29 (APP):In a determined effort to combat the spread of dengue, the Islamabad Capital Territory (ICT) administration has intensified operations, resulting in the arrest of four individuals and the closure of three businesses for violations of standard operating procedures (SoPs) set by the government.
According to the spokesman of ICT administration, the authority has ramped up their anti-dengue campaign, with significant actions taken in Sector F-7.
The Assistant Commissioner (AC) City led an operation that resulted in the arrest of four individuals. These arrests were made due to continuous violations of the Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) designed to curb the spread of dengue.
Three business outlets were also shut down for failing to implement the required anti-dengue measures. These closures are part of a broader effort to ensure compliance with health regulations aimed at preventing the breeding of dengue-carrying mosquitoes.
On the occasion, Deputy Commissioner Islamabad, Irfan Nawaz Memon emphasized the need for city-wide efforts to stop the growth of dengue larvae.
He called for unbiased and comprehensive inspections to be carried out across all sectors of the city. Memon also stressed the importance of keeping citizens informed about ongoing operations and health measures.
The crackdown highlights the city’s commitment to enforcing health guidelines and protecting public health. The district administration plan to continue their stringent inspections and enforcement actions until dengue risks are significantly reduced.
